Citizenship classes A review of the National Curriculum in England by the Education Secretary Michael Gove may result in Citizenship classes being made non-compulsory. Andy Thornton, Chief Executive of the Citizenship Foundation, said It would be baffling for the DfE to propose to cut the only subject in the curriculum that explicitly teaches young people about the way that politics, democracy, the law and economy works, and how they can participate in society href="http://www.guardian.co.uk/education/2011/jan/20/dont-scrap-citizenship-teachers-plead"> the Guardian, reports.
